title: Shenzhen theme park closed after 8 people injured in roller coaster collision
description: Shenzhen Happy Valley says it has closed for the weekend while a ‘complete safety check’ is carried out.

title: Chinese students beat stress by turning to Southeast Asia universities
description: A less competitive environment is attracting young people to apply for study programmes in the region.

title: Belt and road: West should work with China to build infrastructure – not against it
description: As the West starts to find its feet with financing for its infrastructure, it would be a pity if the largesse was used to compete with China, when the global scale of the challenge calls for cooperation.

title: ‘Unimpeded trade’: China begins to deliver on US$10 billion promise to African businesses
description: Millions being funnelled to African small businesses as China seeks to expand its trading partners.

title: Chinese university students told to avoid private memorial events for former premier Li Keqiang
description: Some universities have asked student counsellors and leaders not to arrange mourning activities, fearing they could turn into protests.

title: Li Keqiang: former premier who gave scientific research ‘rock-star status in China’
description: ‘Grievously saddened’ science community remembers former premier’s unwavering support for basic research as a driver of national growth.

title: China, US must return to ‘healthy, stable’ ties ‘at an early date’, Foreign Minister Wang Yi tells Biden
description: Wang Yi’s visit is part of a bilateral push for a potential sit-down between Presidents Joe Biden and Xi Jinping on the margins of the San Francisco Apec summit in November.

title: Why Xiangshan Forum could be ‘useful opportunity’ for US-China military ties
description: Senior defence officials, including from the Pentagon, will attend the three-day security conference in the Chinese capital. Beijing and Washington are set to restart talks, but their geopolitical rivalry will likely be a focus at the gathering.

title: Taiwan elections: how Foxconn investigation could backfire on Beijing
description: Analysts say the investigation into the tech giant could end up helping Taiwan’s pro-independence camp.

title: Former premier Li Keqiang’s sudden death ‘a total surprise’ to China’s top leaders
description: ‘State media obviously did not prepare full obituary’ as they do for very ill leaders, while brief initial announcement aimed to quash conspiracy theories, observer says.
